snippet: The government warned people to avoid live poultry and slaughtered more than 20,000 birds at a wholesale market in Shanghai.
abstract: Chinese officials escalated their response after sixth person dies from mysterious avian-borne virus, advising people to avoid live poultry.

byline.contributor: Shi Da contributed research from Beijing. Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The government warned people to avoid live poultry and slaughtered more than 20,000 birds at a wholesale market in Shanghai.

headline.seo: China Escalates Response to Avian Flu Outbreak
headline.main: China Escalates Its Response to Outbreak of Avian Flu
headline.print_headline: China Escalates Its Response to Outbreak of Avian Flu
